intro: Hieracium platyphyllum subsp. valdescabrum, commonly known as the Valdesian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
